titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I wrote to the Yale people enclosing the syllabus of my lectures; & also to Bp. Lawrence suggesting a date for our visit:
The morning was wasted in a Chapter Meeting. Then I celebrated the marriage of Mr Robert A. Gardiner to Miss Loftus. After which I instructed the confirmation candidates until 6 p.m.

On Tuesday evening (Feb. 23rd) we dined with the Grahams. Lord George Hamilton was there, & talked of his Royal Commission. He spoke slightingly of the Salvation Army, but with appreciation of the Church Army. I took in to dinner an American lady named Phipps.
